alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Central and Southern Scott County; Cleburne; Conway; Faulkner; Garland; Hot Spring; Lonoke; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Northern Scott County; Northwest Yell County; Perry; Pulaski; Saline; Southeast Van Buren County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Stone; Western and Northern Logan County; White; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 1:41AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Van Buren, northwestern Lonoke, eastern Scott, eastern Polk, Yell, southeastern Pope, southeastern Stone, southwestern Logan, Perry, Cleburne, southern Conway, Faulkner, western White, Garland, Saline, Montgomery, northern Hot Spring and Pulaski Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 139 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mountain View to Damascus to Danville and Booneville. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Conway... Hot Springs... Benton... Sherwood... Jacksonville... Cabot... Searcy... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Hot Springs Village... Malvern... Downtown Little Rock... Heber Springs... Morrilton... Lonoke... Booneville... Danville... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central and north central Arkansas.
